item.title: Background Information
item.description: Debrief was developed in the mid 90's by the Maritime Warfare Centre in Portsmouth UK to support the analysis and reporting of maritime tactical exercises, and is a free, open source application that makes it possible for analysis organisations to run open contests for support and development contracts to maintain or extend Debrief.

item.title: Document Conventions
item.description:
The following conventions are used within the tutorial:
• Bold is used to identify commands, verbal instructions and other essential information, such as user interface (UI) details/buttons/names, and for emphasis.
• “Bold + quotes” are used to identify filenames and other external references.
• “Quotes” are used to highlight comments in examples.

item.title: Navigating within Debrief
item.description: When you're navigating within Debrief you will need to click on menus, sub-menus, and even sub-sub menus. However, though writing it out as “Click on File on the menu bar, then click on Save As, and finally navigate to where you want to save your file,” is descriptive and accurate, it's pretty laborious and wasteful; so, we shorten it and write it as: File > Save As > file location That's far more succinct and easier.
